thread.title: South Carolinians weigh in on Confederate flag, Graham

title: South Carolinians weigh in on Confederate flag, Graham
text:

The senator who is running for President has a 40 percent approval rating in his home state. That's down from 45.5 percent in March. Post to Facebook South Carolinians weigh in on Confederate flag, Graham The latest Winthrop Poll of South Carolina residents bears bad news for Lindsey Graham. The senator who is running for President has a 40 percent approval rating in his home state. That's down from 45.5 percent in March.  //www.wcnc.com/story/news/politics/2015/09/30/south-carolinians-weigh-in-on-confederate-flag-graham/73112910/   South Carolinians weigh in on Confederate flag, Graham Elizabeth Sanders, esanders@greenvillenews.com 5:36 p.m. EDT September 30, 2015 Confederate Flag CONNECT TWEET   
The latest Winthrop Poll of South Carolina residents bears bad news for Lindsey Graham. The senator who is running for President has a 40 percent approval rating in his home state. That's down from 45.5 percent in March. 
The poll didn't survey residents on all current presidential candidates, but it did ask what they think about current leaders. 
President Obama has a 41 percent approval rating. 
Governor Nikki Haley is higher at 55 percent. 
The poll also looked at controversial issues. 
When it comes to same-sex marriage, half of poll respondents said the union should be recognized by law as valid. When asked if county clerks of probate judges in the state should be allowed to deny a marriage license to same-sex couples, only 34 percent said yes. 
The Confederate battle flag was a hot issue over the summer. Two-thirds of South Carolina residents surveyed said the S.C. Legislature made the right decision in removing the flag from the State House grounds.
